oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Lessons learned about managing treatment protocols
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Schuler, Adlai M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: dairy
mastitis
antibiotic stewardship
treatment
protocols
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Whenever antimicrobial use is implemented into a food production system, federal regulations require and consumers expect that antimicrobial stewardship is at the forefront of the conversation. By taking a team approach to protocol and SOP development, the dairy can leverage the veterinarianâ€™s knowledge of pathogens, antimicrobials, and regulatory requirements to construct a platform for success that ultimately reduces antimicrobial use on farm, meets regulatory requirements, and improves the case outcome for the cow in cases of mastitis.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2019; 301-303
